main event: A sighting of reddish-orange lights in the sky observed in Akron, Ohio on March 22, 1960.
interesting points: The objects were seen tying and untying in the air., Four reddish-orange objects were reported at an altitude of 3000-5000 feet., The objects moved unpredictably, first to the west, then to the north., The sighting lasted for approximately 3 minutes and was silent., Investigations suggested that the objects could possibly be balloons.
witness description: a witness, her two children, and others who observed the event
